result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A. Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 9:31 am
INCLUDES 22CF74 & 21CT310.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig in person:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Dave Casey in person;
VRCW. 
Preliminary Hearing in 22CF74:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

Plea Hearing in both files:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
PLEA: 
21CT310:
Ct. 1 (OWI 1st with Passenger < 16 Years Old-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

22CF74:
Ct. 1 (1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety)>> NO CONTEST.
Ct. 2 (1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
21CT310:
Ct. 1 (OWI 1st with Passenger < 16 Years Old-Repeater)>> 45 Days MCJ to be served w/Huber privileges/EMP. $2,311 Fine inclusive, DNA Sample. Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 16 Months, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed; IID installation fee to be paid; 16 Month dl revocation with any administrative credit; AODA. Court finds 0 Days Credit. Defendant has 45 Days to report to MCJ- report by 07/28/2022.

22CF74:
Ct. 1 (1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety)>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 5 Years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to Dismiss Count 1.

Ct. 2 (1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety)>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 5 Years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to Dismiss Count 2.

DEOJ RH>> 06/09/2027 at 8:45 am
Bond continues.

Adjourned: 9:56 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.
